text: today I'm gonna make really really
really easy dish red snapper coated with
fresh herbs and because it's so easy I
need to make something else so I'm going
to make couscous all you need to do for
couscous is bring some water to a boil
1 cup of water to 1 cup of couscous heat
your oven to 375 that's for the fish
then I'll show you what else I'm going
to do just need a tray or two before me
I have a beautiful array of herbs dill
parsley cilantro and mint I'm not even
going to use all of them choose one
choose three let's see a little bit of
dill and a little bit of parsley these
nice light fresh herbs you're going to
want to use more of so for this I'm just
going to use a combined half cups and if
you're using something like thyme or
oregano or sage just make sure you only
use a teaspoon or so because they're
very strong okay that's good nice and
fine so that it coats really evenly just
place that on anything it can be a plate
I have a sizzle platter you can go out
and get them and they're really useful
for carrying things around the kitchen
okay I have for red snapper fillets so
these are fresh delightful about say
half an inch thick and six or eight
ounces each the skin is on salt course
easier to sprinkle as I always say I'm
using but I don't know half teaspoon for
the whole thing a little bit of pepper
and then what I'm going to do is I'm
going to dollop each one with a little
bit of mustard and then I'm going to
spread it on that way there's no
cross-contamination which is pretty
gross that was about a half a tablespoon
of mustard I'm going to lay my baking
tray rub it all over I do this with my
hands so now what you want to do is take
your fish and put it mustard side down
into your herbs just to coat it like
this
see and then put its skin side down on
the oiled pan that's all you have to do
and then they go into the oven and then
yes you're going to wash your hands they
are keen ok to the oven with you 12 to
15 minutes now all I have to do is make
my couscous which since my water is now
boiling will take three minutes just add
your couscous straight to your water
that's boiling turn off your water cover
your pot let it sit for three to five
minutes we are done so for the couscous
all you really need to do after it sits
for five minutes is open it up and then
fluff the grains you could add a little
bit of butter some herbs if you wanted
to but I'm not going to because look at
all those herbs who needs them all this
left to do is sur slightest a long
spatula if you have a fish spatula use
it now underneath your fillet to
transfer it from the pan but look that
it didn't stick it all which is
fantastic the skin helps that a little
bit that's it you just serve it super
simple takes 15 minutes start to finish
because the only real prep you need to
do is chopping up a few herbs
hey wallah as usual beautiful but I'm
going to add one more thing this dish
really didn't need anything else but I
added a little bit of lemon just for
that extra special touch
